entry.title: Voice Republic
entry.content:
Voice Republic is a platform for high-quality spoken content, with headquarters in Zürich and Berlin. It offers a proprietary live-streaming and archiving solution to conferences, lecture series, book fairs and individual podcasters, as well as place for listeners to find thousands of hours of interesting content. Notable appearances on the platform include Edward Snowden, Slawoj Zizek and Angela Merkel.

The Voice Republic home page

A typical "Talk" page

Background

Before I joined Voice Republic in the Spring of 2015 as Head of Product Design, the UX had been patched together by a series of freelance designers. It lacked cohesion and features were competing with each other for attention.

The "Talk" page before the redesign

At the same time, the team was pivoting away from a collaborative-stage model—where listeners could request the microphone—to more of a traditional live-broadcast model. They asked me to join the team in order to give the design a refresh and ensure that all the new features would cohere to the new design.

The Redesign

We went through lots of different shenanigans...

Early redesign concepts

One of the early design deliverables was this responsive demo to test how the platform could look at various screen sizes.

An early design mockup

As Head of Product Design at Voice Republic, my role included the following:

  • Strategy: I consult the key stakeholders on design and UX enhancements. I work closely with the developers to ensure that design suggestions are realistic to build within the given resources.
  • Workshops: Occasionally I lead design workshops to gather requirements and brainstorm solutions.
  • UX: I create wireframes and mockups for new features and apps.
  • Interaction Design & Prototyping: I deliver browser-based prototypes of each new feature for validation, testing and documentation.
  • Front-End: I implement the designs using HAML, JQuery, Rails, SCSS and Clojurescript.

The Voice Republic site is constantly changing. And with such a small team, it's hard to accomplish even a portion of the things on our roadmap. But I'm happy with lots of the improvements we've made to the UX and design.
